::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-sm-8}
I'm an aspiring epidemiologist currently pursuing post-graduate studies in [Epidemiology](https://www.liberty.edu/residential/health-sciences/masters/public-health/epidemiology/) at [Liberty University](https://www.liberty.edu/residential/). I have previously obtained degrees in [psychology](https://www.liberty.edu/residential/behavioral-sciences/bachelors/psychology/) and [biostatistics](https://www.statistics.com/certificate/biostatistics-certificate-program/) in 2020 and 2023.

I'm interested in clinical epidemiology, epidemiological research methods, infectious diseases, pharmaco-epidemiology and nutritional epidemiology. I love mathematical applied statistics and the [R programming language](https://www.r-project.org/), one of the best tools for clinical statistics and epidemiological research.

I'm currently taking a deep dive into generalized linear models, causal inference and data visualization. Nowadays, I'm conducting a pilot study to analyze the impact of new hire training on performance in a fast-paced contact center environment for the financial services division of a large university.
